title: Senior Consultant
content:
Senior Consultant
About United Minds
United Minds, part of the Weber Shandwick Collective, is Weber Shandwick’s in-house management consultancy that helps clients transform their organizations, with a particular focus on the people’s side of change. We are dedicated to making business more human through organizational transformation.
It is through this enduring purpose that we are able to work each day alongside a global team of warm, intelligent business strategists, writers, organizational psychologists, photographers, actors and teachers.
Together, we support change management, leadership impact, DE&I, employee experience and culture initiatives for some of the world’s most recognizable brands.
 
Job Summary
We are looking for a Senior Consultant to join our North America team that can lead client-consulting projects, contribute to thought leadership, and participate in new business. United Minds operates across the agency’s broader network, effectively delivering access to the opportunities and resources that drive career development and other goal-oriented achievements. 
Responsibilities 
Client Solutions

Manage and contribute to employee communications and engagement projects for large brands, requiring knowledge of change management processes and principles, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Serve as daily client contact and act as client lead when appropriate; address client issues thoughtfully and effectively and oversees and provides guidance on client communications to project lead
Act as a main day-to-day contact for a cross functional team, working with other practices in the Weber Shandwick Collective, to drive holistic solutions for our clients that will have tangible results on their bottom line
Partner with strategic lead to design the project team structure
Oversee development of strategic plans and recommendations tailored to client’s unique organizational profiles, including employee communications & change management programs and/or employee experience projects, consistently producing high quality content
Ensure deliverables are client-ready – reviewing deliverables produced by junior team members

Account and Business Management  

Partner with strategic lead to organically grow the business – identifying new opportunities and proactively
developing client relationships
Drive and/or contributes to development of new business response (depending on scale/scope of opportunity)
Contribute to thought leadership and proactive ideas to our offerings
Oversee budget management including SOW development, managing those monitoring budget tracking (i.e., coordinating with finance and reviewing time runs)
Identify resourcing needs/gaps/opportunities to solve with UM Operations lead
Properly brief and onboard team members and clearly delegates tasks to more junior team members

Talent Strategy and DEI

Build relationships with clients and colleague at all levels
Integrate junior staff into workflow scenarios; possesses the ability to delegate tasks while remaining accountable for outcomes
Supervise junior staff by motivating, coaching, consistently providing feedback, holding them accountable and conducting their reviews
Develop an understanding of diverse teaming and learning to actively look for opportunities to bring new views to an account; build teams to ensure there is representation of diverse talent/views/points of view in the work/team/room
Build diverse network and surfaces opportunities to attract/pipeline/recruit diverse talent into our workforce
Serve as model of positive behaviors around inclusivity and commitment to diverse workplace practices
Complete all required IPG and Weber Shandwick Collective DEI Education

Qualifications

At least 6-8 years’ experience driving employee communications strategies and change management initiatives for large complex organizations - either from the perspective of an agency or a consulting firm, or within a dynamic in-house communications firm
Bachelor’s Degree in communications, public relations, English or related field
Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel

What We Are Looking For  

Master’s Degree in Organizational Development or related field is a plus
Certification in change management methodology (e.g. PROSCI) is a plus
Excellent communication (verbal, written, presentation) and project management skills
Self-directed problem-solver with the ability to develop creative solutions and influence others to action
Ability to professionally interface with clients
Exhibits a willingness to continually learn and adapt
Able to drive results even in ambiguous situations, able to quickly take ownership of process or deliverables
Shows exceptional judgment when working with team members, client contacts and vendors
Ability to share insights, distill findings, and trends with teams to mobilize, develop and motivate
Exhibits a strong commitment to agency and personal growth
Consistently meets (often tight) deadlines
Emphasizes attention to detail and quality, while working with a sense of urgency

 
The Weber Shandwick Collective recognizes that your health and wellbeing are a priority. This is why we offer a full suite of benefits including:

Medical
Dental
Vision
401k (with employer match)
Tuition Reimbursement
Juice Money - $60 monthly reimbursement to be used towards purchases that nourish your health, mind, body, and soul
MyDays – Flexible holiday schedules 
Short-Term Disability 
Paid Employee Family Leave 
Family Building Benefit

United Minds is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. United Minds recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, ethnic or national origin, protected veteran status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status or citizenship status.
